comment.author: 65171012@N00
comment._content:
Hick Cady (1886-1946) born Forrest LeRoy Cady.  1912 was his rookie year, playing 47 games in the regular season, most as a catcher.  His line: .249 with 19 RBIs and 9 runs scored.  

He was Boston's starting catcher in the 1912 World Series against the New York Giants, a series that went 8 games.  Game 2 was called in extra innings due to darkness.  Boston won that series 4 games to 3.
